alert.note: Alert for Blue Earth; Le Sueur; Waseca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 11:16PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Le Sueur, northeastern Blue Earth and northwestern Waseca Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1115 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Arlington to 5 miles east of Hanska. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Le Sueur around 1125 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include New Prague and Montgomery. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 14 between mile markers 131 and 154. U.S. Highway 169 between mile markers 53 and 58, near mile marker 60, and between mile markers 79 and 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for south central and central Minnesota.
